newsitem.title: LEBANON: Beirut Riyad Bank profits up.
newsitem.headline: Beirut Riyad Bank profits up.

text.p: Beirut Riyad Bank announced a 139 percent increase in net profits in 1996 in consolidated results published on Tuesday.
Profits were 5.915 billion Lebanese pounds ($3.8 million) from 2.477 billion pounds in 1995.
Assets increased 35 percent to 829 billion pounds and customer deposits rose 37 percent to 688 billion pounds, the bank said.

Capital was unchanged at 14.4 billion pounds in 1996 but the bank said it carried out an increase of capital on February 24, 1997, to 40.32 billion pounds in accordance with the decisions of an extraordinary shareholders' assembly of April 11, 1996.
The increase brought the bank's capital adequacy ratio to 16 percent, it said.
According to the almanac of the Lebanese Banks Association, Beirut Riyad Bank was owned before the increase in capital by Lebanese and Saudi Arabian shareholders.

It has 11 branches in Lebanon and one in London, the almanac states. It is listed among the Alpha Group of Lebanon's top 18 banks in 1996 in a preliminary survey by Bankdata Financial Services published in March.
The bank issued the following results (in billions of Lebanese pounds):
